project_abstract.cdata: Through the Population and Health Project, the government hopes to (i) improve Maternal and Child Health (MCH) status; (ii) increase contraceptive prevalence to 14 percent by 1992; (iii) assist in controlling the AIDS epidemic; (iv) strengthen the institutional capability of the Ministry of Health (MOH); (v) improve the financing and efficiency of health services; and (vi) improve the demographic data base for population policy development and socioeconomic planning. The project provides for: (i) the development of MCH/FP services, through the Primary Health Care (PHC) network; (ii) development of an Information, Education and Communication (IEC) program; (iii) support to the National AIDS Control program; and (iv) institutional strengthening of the MOH. Finally, the project provides for (v) population data development.
